title: Gilded Opera House Adventure #26
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Costume Storage Room
rooms.description: A cramped backstage room filled with elaborate costumes from past productions. Velvet gowns, feathered hats, and ornate masks hang from racks. The air smells of mothballs and old fabric. Trunks and boxes are stacked against the walls. A single gas lamp flickers, casting dancing shadows across sequined dresses and silk capes.

items.name: costume rack
items.description: A wheeled rack holding elaborate period costumes from various operas

items.name: wardrobe mistress note
items.description: A note tucked into a costume pocket
items.text: Reminder: The opera house opened in 1889 with a performance of La Traviata. Maestro Bellini keeps the orchestra pit key in the prop trunk. The combination is our opening year.

items.name: large prop trunk
items.description: A heavy trunk with brass fittings and a four digit combination lock

items.name: brass key
items.description: A key engraved with musical notes and the words 'Orchestra Pit'

items.name: opening night program
items.description: A preserved program from the opera house's grand opening
items.text: GRAND OPENING 1889: La Traviata by Giuseppe Verdi. Conducted by Maestro Bellini. Stage Manager: Antonio Rossi. This magnificent opera house stands as a temple to the musical arts.

items.name: makeup table
items.description: A cluttered table with mirrors and theatrical makeup

items.name: stage manager's journal
items.description: A leather journal belonging to Antonio Rossi
items.text: Antonio Rossi, Stage Manager: Tonight we perform La Traviata in the grand hall. The royal box offers the finest view. Maestro Bellini conducts with passion. Remember: only those who know our history may access the royal box.

items.name: venetian mask display
items.description: A collection of ornate masks from various productions

items.name: silver opera mask
items.description: An elegant silver mask decorated with crystals

items.name: storage room door
items.description: A wooden door leading to the orchestra pit area

rooms.name: Orchestra Pit
rooms.description: The sunken orchestra pit beneath the stage. Music stands and chairs are arranged in perfect formation. Sheet music is scattered across the conductor's podium. The smell of rosin and wood polish fills the air. Above, the grand stage looms. Ornate railings separate the pit from the audience seating.

items.name: conductor's podium
items.description: An elevated platform with a music stand and baton

items.name: annotated sheet music
items.description: Sheet music for La Traviata with handwritten notes
items.text: La Traviata by Giuseppe Verdi - Maestro Bellini's personal copy. Note in margin: 'This opera, composed by the great Verdi, remains our finest production. The royal box key is hidden in the instrument locker.'

items.name: instrument storage locker
items.description: A tall locker containing various orchestral instruments

items.name: concert master's note
items.description: A note from the lead violinist
items.text: The royal box is reserved for distinguished guests. To enter, one must prove knowledge of our opera house: What opera did we open with? Who composed it? Who conducts our orchestra?

items.name: ornate golden key
items.description: A decorative key with 'Royal Box' engraved on it

items.name: first violin music stand
items.description: A stand with more sheet music and performance notes
items.text: Performance notes: La Traviata, composed by Giuseppe Verdi, conducted by Maestro Bellini. This production showcases the finest talents of our opera house.

items.name: velvet opera glasses case
items.description: An elegant case sitting on a chair

items.name: mother of pearl opera glasses
items.description: Exquisite opera glasses with mother of pearl inlay

items.name: grand staircase to royal box
items.description: A carpeted staircase leading up to the royal box. A velvet rope blocks access, and a brass plaque displays three questions.

password_questions.question: What opera opened this house?
password_questions.hint: Check the opening night program and various notes around the opera house

password_questions.question: Who composed this opera?
password_questions.hint: The sheet music and performance notes mention the composer

password_questions.question: Who conducts the orchestra?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents reference the conductor's name

rooms.name: Royal Box
rooms.description: You have reached the magnificent royal box! Plush velvet seats face the grand stage below. Crystal chandeliers sparkle overhead. The view of the entire opera house is breathtaking. Gilded railings and ornate decorations surround you. A private exit door leads to the street outside, offering your escape from the opera house.

items.name: plush velvet seats
items.description: Luxurious seating reserved for royalty and distinguished guests

items.name: crystal chandelier
items.description: A magnificent chandelier casting prismatic light throughout the box

items.name: gilded railing
items.description: An ornate gold railing overlooking the stage and audience below

items.name: commemorative plaque
items.description: A brass plaque mounted on the wall
items.text: This Royal Box was inaugurated in 1889 at the grand opening of our opera house. May the arts flourish here for generations to come.

rooms.win_message: Congratulations! You have reached the royal box and found the private exit to freedom! As you step through the door into the cool night air, you hear the faint strains of La Traviata echoing from within. You have successfully navigated the mysteries of the Gilded Opera House and made your escape. Bravo! You win!
